reviewText: Viewed: 2/13Rate: 42/13: Talk about overacting and bad acting all in one. Just about everybody in the cast is guilty of one or the other. It's hard to watch the all-time bad, washed-out actors/actresses and try to appreciate the comedy, or the lack thereof, of Once Upon a Crime. I've never liked Sean Young (who stunk the film up like a dead cheese), the inevitable motor-mouth John Belushi, and Richard Lewis (why does he always flaps his arms around all the time? Is it because he sucks in acting? Or does he think that it makes for comedy?). Cybil Sheppard has no talent to speak of since the days of the The Last Picture Show, and all she did in that one was take off her clothes for her fifteen minutes of fame. The overtanned George Hamilton is clearly carrying the same shtick from Zorro, The Gay Blade. Giancarlo Giannini overdoes his subtlety. So, the only saving grace of the film is John Candy who had a couple of witty lines to work with. And that's about it. I did laugh, but it was out of pity. All in all, Snatch played the dog angle much, much better than Once Upon a Crime.
Title: N/A

reviewText: From the very first time i saw this film 8 years ago on cable at 3 in the morning,i've been hooked.I can't get enough of this film,and it's hard to  explain why.It's definitely a guilty pleasure.Maybe it's John Candy's  recovering compulsive gambler(which i feel is his funniest performance),or  Jim belushi as an American tourist who aids in Candy's relapse.Or the the  Dauchsund named Napolean who steals scenes as the most wanted dog in  Europe,because of the reward that's being offered for his safe return,by  his rich widowed owner Madame Van Dougen.Or George Hamilton as an  aging(more like aged)playboy named Alphonso Delapena,who sleeps with rich  married women in an attempt to get them to finance his gambling  addiction.Cybill Sheppard plays Belushi's doormat for a wife,who gets her  revenge with the help of a character named Hercules Popodopolous from  Athens.Another subplot includes Richard Lewis as a struggling actor whose  agent has just dumped him,and he teams up with Sean Young to return the dog  to M.Van Dougen.When they try to return the little guy,they discover his  owner has been murdered,and now all the characters are suspects because  they're all connected by a train to Monte Carlo all of them were on in the  beginning of the film.If you like your comedy light and harmless,then this  one's for you.
summary: An entertaining comedic romp that does'nt embarass
Title: N/A

reviewText: ONCE UPON A CRIME answered the question for me, "What is a comedy movie?" It is a movie that makes you laugh.  The film is silly, has a contrived plot, uses stereotypes, is littered with cliches, and that's just for starters.  Somehow, however, it makes you laugh a lot.  That's comedy for me because I enjoy laughing. Candy and Belushi made me laugh at their gambling addictions.  The French police made me laugh as they handled  their rich American quarry. The film begins as a mystery of sorts.  Forget about that end of the story. It is a comedy, not a mystery despite the hilarious suitcase full of body parts. Perhaps this hopelessly laughable movie is a new genre--mysterious comedy.

reviewText: I would rate this movie as a 10 if I could. I absolutely love, love this movie. It is so much fun. I never get tired of watching it. I originally bought this movie in VHS formatting, then later I also bought is in DVD format. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys fun, light movies.

reviewText: An all star casts (James Belushi, Cybil Shepperd, Sean Young, George Hamilton, Ornella Mutti, Giancarlo Giannini, and the late John Candy) get  mixed up in Monte Carlo because of a murder of a wealthy woman. It is  mindless entertainment and pure fun. Too bad, it was a flopped when  released in theatres almost 10 years ago. Watch this and you won't be  sorry. You will want to have it in your collection as you can watch it  again and again from time to time to have a great time. Now MGM please  release this on DVD and include bloopers as I imagine will be plenty for  this kind of movie. Excellent and funny. Brilliantly directed by Eugene  Levy.
Title: N/A
